item.title:
Fear of large predators drives smaller predators into human-inhabited areas they perceive as safer—but where risk is greater, a new Science study finds. The results describe a “paradox of the lethal human shield.”
Learn more: https://t.co/Pqbo9sZX1V; https://t.co/TF3zLHl4xX https://t.co/pGvMyXry7O

item.title:

item.title: @blamlab @MillerLabMIT What gets people worked up is invoking "emergence" without describing what one means more clearly. My current position is that we need to use it more carefully and precisely. But in general the promise of straightforward "reduction" or "emergence" are both problematic.

item.title:
⚪ What’s a rule of thumb?
The AI community should treat a system as highly dangerous if it has a capability profile sufficient for extreme harm, 𝘢𝘴𝘴𝘶𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 it's misused or poorly aligned.
Developers would need to show a very high standard of safety to deploy it. https://t.co/wjotF9vsEV
